cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest through the Florida Straits Sunday, forecast to turn west on Monday and track across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central/eastern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm/hurricane watches confined to South-Central and Southwest Florida coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Warnings limited to Florida Keys, South Florida Atlantic and Gulf coasts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida, Florida Keys, Bahamas and portions of the Gulf Coast; Atlantic coast north of Florida (including South Carolina) not in impact zone
weather_observation.wind: Very low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late in the 5-day period; otherwise typical fall northeasterlies.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; NHC guidance shows <1–2 ft south of Altamaha Sound, GA.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only occasional showers expected; heavy tropical rainfall banding remains well south and west of South Carolina.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along South Carolina beaches from distant swells.
